category: Herbs that Clear Heat and Purge Fire

action.primary: Harmonizes the Stomach, descends Rebellious Stomach Qi and relieves diarrhea

indications: Prevents the drying, dispersing and ascending nature of diaphoretic herbs from harming the body

action.primary: Removes stagnant Food, promotes diuresis and removes toxin

contraindications: Use with caution for those with Stomach Qi Deficiency.
interactions: The caffeine in Lu Cha may be potentiated when given in conjunction with oral contraceptives and cimetedine.
The combination of caffeine with theophylline and ephedrine may lead to increased thermogenesis, weight loss, agitation, tremors and insomnia.
Combination of excessive amounts of caffeine and monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOI) such as phenelzine (Nardil), tranylcypromine (Parnate) and isocarboxazid (Marplan can cause hypertensive crisis.
This herb may reverse MRSA and PRSA and may lower minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of oxacillin and other beta-lactams in MRSA.
